name: Project Euler
tagline: Source code by Kyle Fung to solve computational problems
body:
# Welcome to my project page
On this page I will post the source code to some of the programs I have written to solve computational problems from www.projecteuler.net/problems

## [Problem 1] (https://github.com/KyleFung/Project-Euler/blob/master/Multiples%20of%203%20and%205.cpp)
###[Multiples of 3 and 5](http://projecteuler.net/problem=1)
If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below 1000.

Answer: 233168

## [Problem 2] (https://github.com/KyleFung/Project-Euler/blob/master/Even%20Fibonacci%20Numbers.cpp)
###[Even Fibonacci numbers](http://projecteuler.net/problem=2)
If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below 1000.

Answer: 4613732

## [Problem 3] (https://github.com/KyleFung/Project-Euler/blob/master/Largest%20Palindrome%20Product.cpp)
###[Largest palindrome product](http://projecteuler.net/problem=4)
A palindromic number reads the same both ways. The largest palindrome made from the product of two 2-digit numbers is 9009 = 91 Ã— 99.

Find the largest palindrome made from the product of two 3-digit numbers.

Answer: 906609
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
